result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent W. Geffert

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:20 PM Defendant Brent W. Geffert in court.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Brent W. Geffert.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Duren acknowledges rec. information and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Duren stands mute.  Court enters not guilty plea(s) - Atty Duren to get plea/sent date from JA.  Bond continued.

11:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brent W. Geffert in court.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Brent W. Geffert. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  State requests arraignment be set out.  Matter reset.  State to file an Information within the time period.
Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.

01:07 PM Defendant Brent W. Geffert in court with attorney Blake Duren.  Gabe Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Duren requests a preliminary hearing date.  Matter reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.

03:01 PM Defendant Brent W. Geffert in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Markoski.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brent W. Geffert appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties. DE does not qualify for PD representation.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State requests signature bond w/conditions.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $10,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute Sobriety at all times. Must submit to chemical testing if requested by law enforcement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
